page.title: 01Chirmorrie & Laggish Farms
page.content: Squares 1,2,3,6 & 7 are taken up purely by afforestation again belonging to the forestry commission. This is some of the poorest if not the p@oorest ground in the area under trees being a large blanket bog. However the trees are responding very well to sound structural techniques and are all at the post thicket stage now. .45 of sq. 5 .25 of sq. 6 all of sq. 10 in the main inby ground for Chivmorrie Farm, the buildings being in 09.9. Laggish farm takes up all of blocks 8,11 & 12. However blocks 8.11 & 12 have since been sold and are due for afforestation. The ground is very exposed although very fertile & contains large areas of arable quality within the farm areas. Luggish and Chirmorrie are both very famous in the area for high class breeding of Blackface Rams.
